page.title: 03WORK AND MOBILITY
page.content: Each of the villages -predominantly well maintained two-storey cottages and houses of great character and charm - is surrounded by farmland where ever-increasing mechanisation has meant less and less work for the indigent labour force. Older villagers recall that, where it once took 20 men to bring in the harvest, it now takes only three. The younger generation have gravitated to jobs in the nearby towns of Brackley, Banbury, Bicester, Buckingham and Northampton. Some work at Cowley Motors,Oxford; local "service" jobs include the R.A.F.and the American base at Upper Heyford, four miles distant. A few professional people commute to London.
